intro: Diplotaxis catholica subsp. siettiana, commonly known as the Siettian dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, linear leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and natural habitats.
